channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: They disagree about a lot, but these singers figure out how to stay in harmony
item.description: Members of the North Fork Community Choir in Paonia, Colo., aim to set aside their opinions on big topics when they sing. When differences arise, they figure out creative solutions to stay in harmony.
item.content:encoded:
Members of the North Fork Community Choir in Paonia, Colo., aim to set aside their opinions on big topics when they sing. When differences arise, they figure out creative solutions to stay in harmony.

(Image credit: Luna Anna Archey for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A more severe strain of mpox has been detected in the U.S. for the first time
item.description: The patient was traveling from East Africa, where the mpox disease is endemic. The CDC says the strain does not present a high risk to the general population.
item.content:encoded:
The patient was traveling from East Africa, where the mpox disease is endemic. The CDC says the strain does not present a high risk to the general population.

(Image credit: Smith Collection)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Countries agreed to try to hold global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. Is that still possible?
item.description: In the 2015 Paris Agreement, most countries agreed to try hard to limit global warming to below 1.5 degrees Celsius. Delay and inaction mean that goal is becoming harder to achieve by the day.
item.content:encoded:
In the 2015 Paris Agreement, most countries agreed to try hard to limit global warming to below 1.5 degrees Celsius. Delay and inaction mean that goal is becoming harder to achieve by the day.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Philadelphia criticized for how it's spending millions from opioid lawsuits
item.description: Philadelphia has disputed a state ruling that it should not have spent money from opioid-related legal settlements on home repairs and small businesses in an area ravaged by the drug epidemic.
item.content:encoded: Philadelphia has disputed a state ruling that it should not have spent money from opioid-related legal settlements on home repairs and small businesses in an area ravaged by the drug epidemic.
item.dc:creator: Emily Rizzo

item.title: Artist, scientist, polymath — a new documentary uncovers the real Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: We have a lot of labels for Leonardo da Vinci but a new documentary seeks to understand him as a person.
item.content:encoded:
We have a lot of labels for Leonardo da Vinci but a new documentary seeks to understand him as a person.

(Image credit: Miguel Medina)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'You're doing such a good job': A stranger tells a mom just what she needs to hear
item.description: Emma Carlson Berne was at a restaurant, feeling overwhelmed with her three young children. Then a stranger came over with words she's never forgotten: "What a beautiful family."
item.content:encoded:
Emma Carlson Berne was at a restaurant, feeling overwhelmed with her three young children. Then a stranger came over with words she's never forgotten: "What a beautiful family."

(Image credit: Emma Carlson Berne)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: Accused of violating worker rights, SpaceX and Amazon go after labor board
item.description: SpaceX and Amazon are asking the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals to find the National Labor Relations Board unconstitutional. The federal agency is tasked with enforcing workers' right to organize.
item.content:encoded: SpaceX and Amazon are asking the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals to find the National Labor Relations Board unconstitutional. The federal agency is tasked with enforcing workers' right to organize.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Is it the flu or is it COVID? One at-home test can tell you
item.description: If you've got a fever, cough, aches and pains, and you're wondering, "What virus got me this time?" Now you can find out, without taking a trip to the doctor.
item.content:encoded: If you've got a fever, cough, aches and pains, and you're wondering, "What virus got me this time?" Now you can find out, without taking a trip to the doctor.
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: 2 killed and 10 wounded in shootings near New Orleans parade route
item.description: Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests.
item.content:encoded:
Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests.

(Image credit: David Grunfeld)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: E. coli outbreak linked to organic carrots sickens people in 18 states
item.description: Grimmway Farms recalled an array of its organic whole and baby carrots over concerns of an E. coli outbreak. Recalled carrots were sold at retailers such as Walmart, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.
item.content:encoded:
Grimmway Farms recalled an array of its organic whole and baby carrots over concerns of an E. coli outbreak. Recalled carrots were sold at retailers such as Walmart, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.

(Image credit: Mychele Daniau)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
